title: Rear Bevel Box Oil Change

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Change the rear bevel box oil at the 600 mile (1,000 km) and then every 10,000 mile (16,000 km) services only. At subsequent services check the oil level and top up if necessary.
Position a container beneath the rear bevel box oil drain plug.
Remove the drain and filler plugs and allow all the oil to fully drain out. Discard the sealing washers.
The drain plug is magnetic. It is normal for metallic deposits to be attached to the drain plug magnet.
Wipe the drain plug clean, fit a new sealing washer then refit to the final drive and tighten to
Have an assistant stand the motorcycle upright.
Fully synthetic 75W/90 hypoid oil that meets specification API Service Level GL5. Triumph Performance fully synthetic hypoid oil is recommended
, until the level of oil inside the unit is level with the bottom of the filler.
Incorporating a new washer, refit the plug and tighten to
